m_szDocSumamry: July 3rd, 2014 by Tina Casey   A research team from the Korea Institute of Science and Technology has just come up with a novel solution to the graphene problem: no graphene! While graphene has practically limitless uses in solar power and other clean tech applications, the finicky material is difficult to work with, and the hunt has been on to find more compliant substitutes with similar properties.
